text: Unfortunately, I can't make it that weekend. But it would definitely be something interesting for the bizdev team to take a look at ( <@U2MS4S1UP> <@U2MRX6P52> <@U2N9ASARJ> <@U2MQU5THA> ). Usually, it's not necessary to code (that well) for these events and it gives you both the opportunity to practice your coding skills as well as hack a solution to a business problem. Plus you can win €15.000 :dollar: :dollar: :dollar: cc <@U0D6EPESC>
Oops forgot <@U2N9ASARJ>. Also, this should be a great opportunity to prove that ECE > CIC (little coding reference :wink:)
@koen, <@U0HU55QSD>, <@U2XET32K1> this should be an excellent opportunity to try out these shiny toys that we never get around to play with.

BarterBootcampers, <@U28J1NG92>, @falco, <@U2MRX6P52>, <@U2MQU5THA>, <@U2MS4B4CE>, <@U2MQTTNSC>, you are more than welcome to join. Don't think you won't be able to contribute. Nothing accelerates you learning more than a good hackathon.

<!channel> are we going to enroll in this: <https://dutchopenhackathon.com>? I think we should, and build a prototype of our personal learning profile <@U0ARRNM3R> <@U177W7XH8>. It's interesting to brainstorm how we can use open data to enhance this.

text: <!channel> Say Hello to our new members! <@U2X1F4M6D> and <@U2XET32K1>.  John, Miquel welcome. Feel free to browse around, ask questions and contribute  wherever you like! Especially giphy are always appreciated!

<@U177W7XH8> <@U28J1NG92> <@U0ARRNM3R> <@U2MS4B4CE> Another changelog episode that I consider to be pure gold. James Pearce identities 4 (sic) reasons for open sourcing:

1. Facebook is built on Open Source -> Karma
2. Open Source facilitates conversation about your code and software practices -> Feedback / Research
3. Developers write better code and documentation if it's open source -> Quality
4. Open Source leads to more code reuse within the company -> Efficiency
5. Open Source allows you to tell a story about the company -> Marketing / Recruitment
6. Open Source makes Onboarding easier -> Recruitment 

<https://changelog.com/podcast/211>

attachments.title: The Changelog #211: Open Source at Facebook with James Pearce
attachments.text: James Pearce, Head of Open Source at Facebook, joined the show to talk about that very subject — open source at Facebook, his path to software development, why he's the person to lead open source at Facebook, their view on open source, their culture of open source, how they choose what to open source, and more importantly — how they focus on, support, and nurture the community.
attachments.fallback: Changelog: The Changelog #211: Open Source at Facebook with James Pearce

text: <@U0ARRNM3R> <@U0HU55QSD> A suggestion to improve embedly rendering. Embedly adds a trailing slash (/) to resources if they are not there. Since the url is also our query key, this means that it won't be found if this is missing. This is temporary bug, that will be fixed automatically when I add the other features on the roadmap. For now, please check the urls if a resource is failing altogether. Just adding a slash may do miracles...
